author: ajsutton
content:
I don't agree that there's no increased risk of large blocks being orphaned.  We're seeing a lot of blocks in the first slot of the epoch be orphaned because their processing time is higher (there's a spec change coming to fix that, plus client optimisations done & in progress).  When you add in transaction execution, more full blocks will similarly take more time to create and more time to propagate around the network, increasing the risk of being orphaned.
I'm not even sure the risk is lower, in PoW on average you have 14 seconds or so before the next one is found, in Eth2 you only have 4 seconds until attestations are generated.
